description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows kernel security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-21362):

1. Identify your Windows version and corresponding build number from the list below:
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22631.3155
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22621.3155
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22000.2777
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.19045.4046
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.19044.4046
2. Download the appropriate update package from the official Microsoft Update Catalog links:
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5034763](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034763)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5034765](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034765)
   - For Windows 10 and 11 Version 21H2: [KB5034766](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034766)
   - For Windows 10 for x64 Systems: [KB5034774](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034774)
3. Apply the updates as outlined in the installation instructions.
4. Restart your system after the installation to ensure all changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This update addresses a potential time-of-check time-of-use (TOCTOU) race condition that could allow an attacker to bypass security features.
- Be sure to check for any prerequisites or specific instructions outlined in the KB articles related to each update.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure that your system is updated with the latest drivers and firmware.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
